titleStmt.title: A song of &C;ulgi -- an English prose translation

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

sourceDesc.p: Sources are listed in the header of the composite text

body.p: &X;&X; pure from birth &X;&X;. &X;&X; in the Land &X;&X;.
My king went to Eridug. Great prince, Father Enki, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to Eridug. Great prince, Father Enki, rejoice!
My king went to Nibru. Great Mountain, Father Enlil, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to Nibru. Great Mountain, Father Enlil, rejoice!
My king went to the E-&c;u-me-&c;a. Lord Ninurta, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to the E-&c;u-me-&c;a. Lord Ninurta, rejoice!
My king went to Ke&c;. Ninsumun-zid-gal-ana, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to Ke&c;. Ninsumun-zid-gal-ana, rejoice!
My king went to Urim. Lord A&c;imbabbar, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to Urim. Lord A&c;imbabbar, rejoice!
My king went to the E-babbar. &X;&X; lapis-lazuli beard, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to the E-babbar. &X;&X; lapis-lazuli beard, rejoice!
My king went to Kulaba. Ninirigal, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to Kulaba. Ninirigal, rejoice!
My king went to Zabalam. &X;&X; Inana, rejoice! &C;ulgi went to Zabalam. &X;&X; Inana, rejoice!
